title: Birman-Hilden theory for 3-manifolds
abstract:
Given a branched cover of manifolds, one can lift homeomorphisms along the
cover to obtain a (virtual) homomorphism between mapping class groups.
Following a question of Margalit-Winarski, we study the injectivity of this
lifting map in the case of $3$-manifolds. We show that in contrast to the case
of surfaces, the lifting map is generally not injective for most regular
branched covers of $3$-manifolds. This includes the double cover of $S^3$
branched over the unlink, which generalizes the hyperelliptic branched cover of
$S^2$. In this case, we find a finite normal generating set for the kernel of
the lifting map.
